issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
During testing I found that ENIs will remain in detaching state when using security groups with the rule set shown below.  I've waiting for 10-20 minutes for the ENI to transition from in-use/detaching but it seems stuck in this state. This has been easily reproducible using multiple instances, enis, and security groups as long as the group has the rule set below. 
I have not tested a minimum number of rules needed to reproduce. I suspect it's either the number of rules or the rule allowing protocol 132/sctp. 
Update: It appears the timing on attach/detach combined with a security group rules may be what causes this. Maybe a race condition or small window of time where this can occur? 

Thanks,
-M

{code}
In [22]: vm1 = vt.get_test_instances(zone='one', group_id=group.id, vpc_id=vpc.id, subnet_id=subnet.id, count=1)[0]

In [23]: eni = user.ec2.connection.create_network_interface(vm1.subnet_id)
user.ec2.modify_network_interface_attributes(eni, group_set=[group])
In [24]: eni.attach(vm1.id, 11); eni.update(); eni.detach()
                  
In [24]: user.ec2.show_security_group(group)
 Security Group: VpcSuite_1_147355635219/sg-12ef8cf9, VPC: vpc-60f253ee                                         
 INGRESS RULES:                                                                                                 
     +---------------------+--------------------------+-------------+--------------+-------+----------+-------+ 
       CIDR_IP               SRC_GRP_NAME               SRC_GRP_ID    OWNER_ID       PORT    END_PORT   PROTO   
     +---------------------+--------------------------+-------------+--------------+-------+----------+-------+ 
       0.0.0.0/0             None                       None          None           100     100        udp     
       0.0.0.0/0             None                       None          None           22      22         tcp     
       0.0.0.0/0             None                       None          None           -1      -1         icmp    
       0.0.0.0/0             None                       None          None           100     100        tcp     
       0.0.0.0/0             None                       None          None           None    None       132     
     +---------------------+--------------------------+-------------+--------------+-------+----------+-------+ 
                                                                                                                
 EGRESS RULES:                                                                                                  
     +---------------------+--------------------------+-------------+--------------+-------+----------+-------+ 
       CIDR_IP               SRC_GRP_NAME               SRC_GRP_ID    OWNER_ID       PORT    END_PORT   PROTO   
     +---------------------+--------------------------+-------------+--------------+-------+----------+-------+ 
       0.0.0.0/0             None                       None          None           None    None       -1      
     +---------------------+--------------------------+-------------+--------------+-------+----------+-------+ 

{code}
fields.summary: VPC- Security Group Config can cause ENIs to remain in detaching state

comments.body: [~mclark] will check if the delay is visible on the NC.

Reproduced using the QA test from above. 

{code}
from nephoria.testcases.ec2.network.vpc_suite import VpcSuite
vt = VpcSuite(clc='10.111.1.134', password='*******', log_level='DEBUG',  log_file='VPC_TEST_RESULTS.txt')
vt.test6q0_eni_attach_detach_ping_multiple_enis_subnets_groups(clean=False)
...
...
ERROR DURING QUICK ATTACH/DETACH TEST:"ERRORS after elapsed:180/180:"ENI:eni-0ddf478b attachment data still shows it is attached to this instance:i-46ab2b41""
{code}


From the NC log it appears as if the NC processed the detached within 1 second. After waiting 5 minutes after the detach request, the cloud is still showing the ENI in the 'detaching' state. 

{code}
2016-09-20 13:36:49  INFO | gni populated in 5.04 ms.
2016-09-20 13:36:49  INFO | [i-46ab2b41][eni-0ddf478b][eni-attach-7b87f389] attached network interface successfully
2016-09-20 13:36:56  INFO | gni populated in 5.02 ms.
2016-09-20 13:37:01  INFO | gni populated in 5.04 ms.
2016-09-20 13:37:01  INFO | [i-46ab2b41][eni-attach-7b87f389] processing detach network interface request
2016-09-20 13:37:01  INFO | [i-46ab2b41][eni-attach-7b87f389] detached network interface successfully
2016-09-20 13:37:26  INFO | gni populated in 4.90 ms.
2016-09-20 13:37:55  INFO | gni populated in 4.92 ms.
2016-09-20 13:38:26  INFO | gni populated in 4.90 ms.
2016-09-20 13:38:56  INFO | gni populated in 4.85 ms.
2016-09-20 13:39:26  INFO | gni populated in 4.99 ms.
2016-09-20 13:39:56  INFO | gni populated in 4.90 ms.
2016-09-20 13:40:25  INFO | gni populated in 4.84 ms.
2016-09-20 13:40:56  INFO | gni populated in 15.99 ms.
2016-09-20 13:41:26  INFO | gni populated in 5.19 ms.
2016-09-20 13:41:56  INFO | gni populated in 5.00 ms.
2016-09-20 13:42:25  INFO | gni populated in 5.13 ms.
2016-09-20 13:42:57  INFO | gni populated in 4.90 ms.

{code}

[~dmitrii] [~sjones] [~tsugawa] Not sure who should look at this one next. I've moved this ticket to un-assigned.  I can provide more info and/or a setup in this state if anyone would like to take a look.
Thanks!
-M

If NC is processing the detach, it is likely that eucanetd successfully processed the detach (it may be worth looking into mido if eni-0ddf478b is not connected to any bridge.

Did the NC successfully detach the ENI? Was vn_eni-0ddf478b interface removed from NC?

I don't see why a security group rule would cause this. Does detach work with a different set of SG rules?

Hi [~tsugawa], 
- I checked the interfaces on the NC during this state and did not see the interfaces associated with the ENI. 

- I've also checked the Mido bridge while in this state and do not see any references to the ENI mac or IP.  (ie mido bridge "vb_vpc-6fffeed4_subnet-aaee36b5" for eni.subnet_id: 'subnet-aaee36b5', eni.vpc_id: 'vpc-6fffeed4'). Is there another mido resource which might have entries for this ENI?

- In my last 3-4 tests the ENI does transition out of detaching state after roughly ~5-15 minutes. 

- The Security group may have nothing to do with the fault, maybe just coincidence. In my first few attempts to reproduce this manually, I noticed that the size of the security group seemed to contribute to the ENI getting into this state. I was not able to reproduce until changes the security group to something similar in the automated test. It could also be that the security group I used happens to be referenced by another ENI on that instance, or not, etc..

Thanks!
-M

[~mclark], midonet-cli -A --midonet-url=http://localhost:8080/midonet-api -e host name name_of_the_nc list binding will show all interface bindings of an NC.

Looks like NC-CC-CLC communication/state transition problems.
[~tony] reassigning to you because I will need help setting up a system that can reproduce manually this problem. We need to figure out where the problem is.
Handing over to [~mclark] since he reported the issue initially and can help reproduce.
Ran both the CI automated suite's test unit as well as the attach,sleep2, detach 10 times in a loop. The average detach time in this scenario is about 75 seconds.
